doc.after: Santa Anna had successfully escaped towards Vince's Bridge.[261] Finding the bridge destroyed, he hid in the marsh and was captured the following day.[256] He was brought before Houston, who had been shot in the ankle[Note 15] and badly wounded.[258] Texian soldiers gathered around, calling for the Mexican general's immediate execution. Bargaining for his life, Santa Anna suggested that he order the remaining Mexican troops to stay away.[262] In a letter to Filisola, who was now the senior Mexican official in Texas, Santa Anna wrote that "yesterday evening [we] had an unfortunate encounter" and ordered his troops to retreat to BÃ©xar and await further instructions.[259]
